Gruffudd Gryg (fl. c.1340–1380) was a Welsh poet from Anglesey, North Wales.
A number of Gruffudd's poems have survived including poems to a wave during his pilgrimage to Santiago de Compostela and to an April moon.  Also extant are the debate poems between Gruffudd and his contemporary poet and friend Dafydd ap Gwilym.  He also composed two elegies for Dafydd ap Gwilym.
